Dear Sheffield City Council,
1) What percentage of children in your LA with EHCP receive EOTIS in line with s61? What percentage have a school named but their education provision is provided in full via s19 (including alternative provisions)? What percentage are electively home-educated?
2)In the last 12 months how many requests to deregister a child from a special school have you received.
3) In the last 12 months how many children have been deregistered from a special school to elective home education?
4)(a)How long did the process take from the parental request to LA confirming consent for deletion from roll?
(b)Did the LA refuse consent on any occasion in the last 12 months? If yes on what grounds
Yours faithfully,
Michelle Zaher
Educational Freedom

Dear Michelle Zaher,
Thank you for your request for information relating to special school
deregistration which we received on 19/11/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt

your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 18/12/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,

Dear Michelle Zaher,
Thank you for your request for information relating to special school
deregistration which we received on 19/11/2024.
Please see the response below.
What percentage of children in your LA with EHCP receive EOTIS in line
with s61?
• 0.87% children and young people with an EHCP are EOTAS.
What percentage have a school named but their education provision is
provided in full via s19 (including alternative provisions)?
• All children and young people who are EOTAS do not have a school named
on their plan.
What percentage are electively home educated?
• 0.75% of children and young people with an EHCP are recorded as home
educated.
2. In the last 12 months how many requests to deregister a child from a
special school have you received.
• We have had three requests for deregistration at special schools.
3. 3) In the last 12 months how many children have been deregistered from
a special school to elective home education?
• Zero
4a) How long did the process take from the parental request to LA
confirming consent for deletion from roll?
• One took 11 months. The other two are ongoing and so information is
not held to answer this question.
4b) Did the LA refuse consent on any occasion in the last 12 months? If
yes on what grounds
• We have not refused any.
Under the Freedom of Information Act 2000, please can you disclose the
following information:
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be

requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains

If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an

If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see

for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Please can I clarify your answer to q1 the second part re s19 Education Act 1996, by your answer does that mean at this time in your LA there are no children too sick to attend school for a substantial length of time but with a full expectation that they will return to attending their school even part time once their health improves, and / or no children who are currently receiving education in full under s19 due to ongoing safeguarding risks if they where to attend school at this time.
Yours sincerely,
Michelle Zaher
Educational Freedom
